column4: In Ubuntu 9.10 I dont see any user accounts except root. How do I modify user accounts?
Where are you looking for user accounts?
Looking in system/ admin / users and groups
Coffee_:And if you "click to make changes"?
on the keys, that is.
moria: Clicked on make changes and just root shows up
weird
Coffee_: the "Add User" button is greyed out?
Nope, I can do all functions except user accounts dont show up
So no buttons are greyed out but you aren't seeing any users other than root listed?
Thats correct.
who are you logged in as?
if you click on  "Add User" and create a new users, does that user appear?
Im logged in as my user account. Then I click on keys and provide root password and no users show up.
Ill try that.
moria: Newly created user shows up.
Newly created user does show up
Huh. So you can create new users, but can't see old ones at all? I'm not sure what might be going on.
what if you open terminal and give the "users" command?
Found problem. Somehow my user name does not belong to group and id number is wrong.
Thanks for helping me think this one thru!
np.
